senses.definition: the class of people in British society between the middle class and the upper class. Its members include people such as company directors, professors or barristers, who have a high social status and may earn a lot of money. In modern Britain, however, it is less common to identify people in this way.

examples.x: Even the upper middle class was/were feeling the effects of price rises.
